Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have the best survival stock shelter in north eastern Pennsylvania. But everything has a shelf-life. So I must eat and replace everything that's about to expire. It's nice not to have to plan my meals.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're eating eight year old tomatoes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They're still good for another week.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You know, I think I have some type of cheese in the back of my fridge you might like. [Jim smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I've got some cheese you might like too. In between my toes. [all laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hardy har har. Okay picture this:

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: I really though I was becoming too much of a womanizer. I realized I had shirts in five different women's houses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Still not seeing the problem here.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: All right, truth is I gotta couple love bumps on my ding-dong so, game-over!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was the best of times, it was the awesomest of times. And now Packer wants to come home. And ohh, look who's here to sign off on it! My boo, Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [walks into conference room with Michael and Todd] Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. [Holly and Michael kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You must be Todd.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [shaking Holly's hand] Whoa! I'm sorry, Michael. I thought we were meeting Holly today, not Jennifer Aniston!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [laughs oddly] Very funny. Okay let's get started.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: After you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael! This'll be just us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yes yes yes yes. Just so you know, he's at his funniest when you've given him five shots.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And it also helps if you've had five shots.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I already have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Why is Packer back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is Packer here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why's he talking to Holly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [peering into conference room] Don't know, don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [to Todd] Michael loves you, and your sales speak for themselves.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [excitedly] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sees Holly and Todd shaking hands in the conference room] Yes! The Pack is back! Ladies and gentlemen, I would like to introduce you to a man who needs no introduction, probably because most of you have done it with him. Just kidding he wouldn't be interested in any of you. In all seriousness, Todd Packer, is a permanent salesman at this branch. And I would like to invite you to welcome him with open arms.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What!?

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: It's great to be among friends, but until then, you suckers will do!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice! We got burned!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did! You got burned, because Packer's back! Packer is turning in his car for a desk. He is turning in his condoms, for a condominium! Although he's probably going to have to use condoms from here on out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [seething] Holly, you approved this?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yes I did, I think Todd's gonna make a great addition to the staff.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You did approve it?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What don't you understand about the word approved? It seems some of you don't know what the word approved means.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I have very little patience for stupidity.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [walking in with Gabe behind her] Sorry we're late. Gabe fell in the shower.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm such a klutz!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, it took the fire department forever to get there. [realizing there's a new computer at her desk. Gets very excited] Oh my God, where did this come from?! Who did this?!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got Erin a new computer, because the one at reception sucked. I should know. And I don't wanna say the other one was old, but its I.P. number is one! [laughs sheepishly] Right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Awwh, you're welcome. [they hug] My pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam walks over to him and smiles excitedly while bouncing, Jim imitates her] Can I do something for ya?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just helped someone out. It feels good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. You know, I cleaned our daughter for like, an hour at four a.m. this morning, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So you know the feeling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Special delivery for Dwight K. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't order anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I don't have anything for you. But I do wanna talk to you about something. We have been thinking about where Packer should sit... And we can't just sit around and wait for Creed to die.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well there's a lot of seats in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you wouldn't mind permanently relocating, so that Packer can take this desk here. [Jim looks appalled]

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Thanks man, it'd mean a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have been sitting here for ten years, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: well I was there for twelve years. Plus my name's carved under the desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No it is not.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Is too!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Grunting as he crawls under Dwight's desk. Dwight follows] Let's look at this.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Check it out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't wanna move desks!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't be a baby! Okay! There it is. Packer was here and so was your mom! [Todd starts humping Dwight and Michael who are still under the desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do I have any say in this?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [grunting while humping Michael and Dwight] Don't even watch, Halpert!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in the annex, moving into his new desk. Holds up a red tray with rocks on it] Hey, who's dirt box is this?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, that's our Zen garden.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you grow in here, bullcrap? [puts the tray into the garbage]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [walking into the annex with Jim] Hey, um...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey, what's up guys?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Don't what's up us! You think you're so cute, with your pretty blonde hair!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa, pull it back. Uhm, why did you hire Todd Packer?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Uhm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's seriously awful!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael's recommendation was glowing! And, honestly, he's been nothing but nice to me!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That's how he gets you to take off his panties.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam starts nodding in agreement] Why are you nodding?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: United front...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay, look. We can't fire someone because we don't like him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Right this isn't the U.S. Government.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What are you referencing?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [seems unsure] Everything... Everything.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Do any of you have any concrete complaints about something he's done?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I mean he humped Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well if that's the case, I guess I've gotta be fired too. [all groan in disgust]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [looking at his computer, gasps] Hey! Hey you guys! The Armeth Regado video is up, gather around! [no one moves] Check it out! This guy's on a full beam reach. [watching a sailing video on his computer] They're hiking out like mad! Lock 'em up! Lock 'em up! Nice job! Ughh. [computer is frozen, taps the top of it] This computer's a hunk of jjunk.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey sailor! Come watch it over here! [pats her new computer]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where did you get this?!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam gave it to me!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is a sick computer! Gwen Stefani has this computer! [to Pam, in a fake British accent] Uhhh, Pamela! What does a guy have to do to get, ahem, one of them?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You have a computer Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, but if you donated my computer to Africa, it would become world famous as the slowest computer in Africa. So...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, but listen. We just don't have the budget for it. Okay? Reception needed a computer so we got one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well Andy's desk needs a computer. And, I mean, it's just kinda a coincidence that I work there, but...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, but Reception is a one person department. If I get you a new computer I have to get one for everyone in sales. For Dwight, for Stanley, it would be crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So something good happening to Stanley is crazy now?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not asking for one, I need it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: If you're just handing them out, I want one too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Phyllis, no body is handing anything out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: See, this is what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you gonna play mange on faster?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Hey what's going on you guys? [walking into the kitchen with Holly, Dwight, and Kevin, with whom he fist bumps] Yeahh! Three muska-queers!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [giggling] Mean but good!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So, Todd, this must be nice for you getting off the road. You get to spend some time with your daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: I don't know, I love her and all, but she turned into a bitch. Mostly she's great, but some days she acts like her mom. [Holly is un-amused]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, some girls go through a phase.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, your life is so insane! You should write a book!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Since when did you learn how to read?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I do know how to read though!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know how to read... a menu!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Todd leaves. Kevin laughs uncertainly] He's right. I mean, I could lose some weight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin, in sumo culture, you'd be considered a promising up and comer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [walking through the office, notices Andy with Erin's computer set up at his desk] What the heck! Why do you have Erin's computer!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's crazy, right? Erin just wanted me to have it, so we switched.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Erin is that true?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [nods] I just thought, he really needed a new computer, and he knew so much about that one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Erin, it's not up to you. This computer was for reception! Okay? It's not yours to give away.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam, when I'm freaking out, I just sorta step back and-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not freaking out, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: -take a few breaths, and then I ask myself:

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [to Jim] So you two are married to each other now, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: That's sweet. How's the sex?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [continues working]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walks towards Todd] Hey Packer, I made you some hot chocolate.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 'Cause I wanna let bygones be bygones. Show you I'm cool. You're the new guy. It's cold out. I made too much. I got this awesome hot chocolate recipe from my wife.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's a lot of reasons! [suspicious]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Drink it!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: I think I'll pass. The only hot chocolate I'm into is Viva A Fox. [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [interrupts Dwight trying to force feed Todd] Can I talk to you a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, this hot chocolate thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None of your business.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know you can't actually poison him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It wasn't poison Jim, it was a laxative. People take laxatives all the time. This is just, a lot more of a laxative. Let me handle this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I really think we should join forces on this one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do we think, what would drive him crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pepto-Bismol, in his hot chocolate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've gotta stop with the hot chocolate stuff. I was thinking we can jam his drawers, so they only comes out two inches, then he can see everything in them but he can't get to them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mocking] Ooh does Edgar Allan Poe know about that one? So sinister! That wouldn't annoy a person at all! Where do you come up with this stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay! Well this isn't my best, but call Froggy101, say that we're the tour manager for Justin Bieber, and we're giving away free tickets, we give him a number to call for the tickets, and it's his own number.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who is Justice Beaver?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He... It's a crime fighting beaver.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you write up your best forty ideas and e-mail them to me. Can you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely, I'll e-mail you a hundred.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, write up your list of one hundred, edit it down to your top forty, then e-mail it to me, and I'll read it over.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam. Can I talk to you in private?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know if there's really a private place in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well they put a sign-up sheet on the conference room and I signed us up for three mods. A mod is five minutes. And it started two minutes ago.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking confused] You did that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can we talk about this in the meeting? Because we're a little late.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [walks to conference room with Andy and stares at the sign up sheet with wonder] When did people sign-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mind if I close the door? [after shutting door in the conference room] What you did out there, earlier, was totally un-cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well what was I supposed to do, let you walk all over me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You humiliated me in front of every body!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well I didn't think about it like that. It's just, I can't do anything about it. I can't replace that one unless that computer breaks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, it's pretty broken already.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, well if it breaks all the way I can get you a new one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [looks at her knowingly] Pretty sneaky sis. [knocking on conference room door]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [walking in] Hey cats, we got a jazz session in mod six, nine, and twelve. [Pam and Andy exit as Ryan and others holding saxophones walk in, Pam looks at the sign up sheet in awe]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Jim, the two are alone in the annex] There are over four hundred of these! [indicating a packet of paper]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah I couldn't cut it down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They're all good. So good! Number three:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Andy is seen clicking random things and warning boxes pop up. He pours coffee on his keyboard, puts bologna with mustard in his CD drive, and many other computer harming things] Allow all cookies? Why certainly! Pop-ups? Yes please! Bit torrent streaming from a Somalian music website? Yeah! Why not? [mock baby voice] Oh I hope you don't get sick Mr. Computer. [computer voice] Why are you doing this to me Andy? [normal voice again] Because I hate your programs!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [at Hank's with Michael, talking to Hank] And a '76 that's good to boot, I like that. [Hank smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And you made Hank smile, that doesn't happen often. You're very charming. That is something you should take upstairs, and use on people that really matter. [Hank looks irritated again]

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, Holly mentioned that there were some complaints. And that you had said some things about Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Holly said that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Holy
Quote.Text: She was laughing hysterically that whole time!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess you said something weird about your daughter?

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: She asked me, Michael! It would've been rude not to answer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You've been on the road a long time. And you've been an outdoor cat. And now you have to be an indoor cat, so you can't be peeing all over the walls.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Michael, can I open the kamomo with you. I've been on the road too long. But, I wanna connect with my daughter. And it's not right to call her a bitch in front of strangers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it isn't.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: You're right. I gotta watch my behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Don't give up on me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael and Todd are walking into the office] Okay, every body. I need you to see this. Because maybe there is somebody here that you all underestimated, who will surprise you. Todd Packer, is going to apologize. Kevin! Front and center, come here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I got a lot of numbers here to put together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, we know that you are just trying to save face, we know that you are hurt and embarrassed.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's silly. If anything, I should be apologizing to Packer. Because we all know I can dish it, as good as I can take it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, sweetie, no. You shouldn't be apologizing to Packer. That doesn't make any sense. You ready for this? You ready for this? Gentlemen, start your engines.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: I'm sorry if you were offended by my comments earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, like I said, I wasn't offended, but I'll stand here for the big show.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, do you accept the apology?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't do it Kevin, that's the fake kind of apology.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, go back to the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is textbook. It's so uncool. Ryan does this to me all the time. Like it's some offense to have feelings. Don't do it Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [muttering] Sometimes you over react.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael how's this supposed to work? Packer's gonna keep saying terrible things, and then he's just gonna make half-assed apologies. And we're back to square one.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Okay. You want an apology? Here it goes. Kevin, I am so sorry. You are skinny, and you are a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That-That was maybe too much. Packer is a survivor of divorce Stanley. Packer doesn't speak with his child, Meredith. Packer never lived up to his parent's expectations, Andy. [Andy looks confused and shrugs] Angela loves pussy cats, and Packer loves-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [cutting in] No! Don't!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was going to say dogs! Okay, you know what, this is over! Apology has been issued! And we're through with it. Packer will be here until the day he dies, just like the rest of us!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in a car with Andy, by the dumpster you can see a new computer box] So listen, we have to really scuff this up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No no no no no! We can say that the previous owner was a neat-freak. Or an elegant old lady and she just kept it around in case her grand-kids came to visit, but they died and they never came, I think I'm gonna make myself cry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Andy, this is the deal we made.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [watching Pam scrap his computer] That's probably good. That's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We should break this hinge maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's not go crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Well thanks, will do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [using fake Southern accent, on the phone with Todd Packer, Dwight is also with Jim] Absolutely, now when you get down there, Jo's a little bit, uh, forgetful. So she may have locked the gate, but what you're gonna do is go ahead, hop it, and just head back to the pool. [Michael walks in on Jim and Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: That sounds weird.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is weird! Look at you, perceptive. Now I know why Jo's kept her eye on you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [also In southern accent] And you make sure to get down there and check out that Harry Potter World.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [trying to stop him] Whatever you wanna do in your spare time is up to you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Harry Potter World is supposed to be faaantastic!

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Apparently, as soon as corporate found out I wanted to come in off the road, Jo offered me a cushy new job in Tallahassee. And here's the best part. I'm a huge alligator nerd. I can name you every genus, every sub species. Also I'm a huge boob nerd.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Check it out and have a free butterbeer on us. Keep the receipt and we'll get ya' back!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [trying to hide from Michael what they're doing, he picks up the phone and talks directly into it] All right, so just pack your bags and, uh, be sure to bring those swimming trunks! Bye now! [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I cannot believe this, you're sending Packer to Florida? Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's a jerk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He took my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so you're tricking him into flying to Florida?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It wasn't my first choice, Jim had so many better ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have to tell him. You have to tell him what you did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. That is not part of the plan. That is actually anti-what we're doing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He is my oldest friend, I am going to tell him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait! Why don't we come up with a plan we're all happy about? [Michael leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [plugging in new computer, acting to make people think he got a bad computer] Pam, how is this thing even any better than my old computer?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on Andy! I mean you said you wanted a new computer and this is the best I could do!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where'd you even find this thing, like, in the corner in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I found it in a shelf in the corner of the warehouse. [Darryl gives the camera an odd look]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, well thank you for my garbage computer. [Andy turns it on and looks amazed, clearly happy with it]

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: [walking into Michael's office] You're looking at the new face of corporate. Gonna put the "ass", in Tallahassee!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, about that.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Well we gotta go out and celebrate, tonight!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... I don't know if that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Do you have a ball and chain?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, nothing like that at all.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Listen, I'm gonna tell you something that none of these people have the stones to tell you. It's your girlfriend, man. She's uptight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: I know this stuff can hurt, but I wish someone had said something to me about my ex-wife. All I'm saying is about a month or so, meet me down in Florida, I'll introduce you to all the local [spanks the air] talent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [thinks a moment] Sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: It's gonna be so good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is. [Jim sees them and looks happy] It's gonna be awesome. I think you're really going to enjoy it down there.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry about your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah, he's an ass.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [Brooklyn accent] You ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [imitating] You ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What ah you wicked smaht?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No you ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Who ahh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [kisses her and speaks normally again] You ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: So this new computer you found in the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep. Lucked out.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, you really did. 'Cause I know every INCH of that warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep, super lucky.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Maybe you could go back down there and see if you can find me some extra sick days.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hesitating at the bribe] Yeah. You know what , I think I saw ONE sick day down there.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Really? 'Cause I think maybe I saw five.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Three. [Daryl nods]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm full on corrupt!
